title: 112_s2048
content: SECTION 1. TAX REPORTING FOR LIFE SETTLEMENT TRANSACTIONS. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to include a new section requiring returns for certain life insurance contract transactions. Every person involved in a reportable policy sale of a life insurance contract must submit a return for the taxable year, including details such as names, addresses, TINs of the parties, sale date, issuer information, and payment amounts. Every person required to make a return for a reportable policy sale of a life insurance contract must provide a written statement to each person listed in the return, including contact information and required return details. The statement does not need to include certain information for issuers of life insurance contracts. Additionally, sellers must report the basis in life insurance contracts upon receiving the required statement. Upon receipt of the required statement or notice of transfer to a foreign person, life insurance contract issuers must provide a return with seller's details, investment in the contract, and policy number. Sellers must report the basis in contracts upon receiving the statement. Every person making reportable death benefits payments must submit a return with their contact information and details of each recipient. The section requires the submission of payment details including recipient's name, address, TIN, payment date, and amount. Additionally, a written statement must be provided to each recipient with contact information and payment details. The section defines key terms related to reportable policy sales, including payment, issuer, and reportable death benefits. The table of sections for subpart B of part III of subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended. Section 6050X requires returns for certain life insurance contract transactions. Amendments to section 6724 of the Internal Revenue Code include adding clause (xxvi) for this purpose. Section 6050X mandates returns for specific life insurance contract transactions. Amendments to section 6724 of the Internal Revenue Code involve adding clause (xxvi) for this purpose. Additionally, changes are made to section 6047 regarding information related to these transactions. The amendments made by this section apply to reportable policy sales and death benefits after December 31, 2012. SEC. 2. CLARIFICATION OF TAX BASIS OF LIFE INSURANCE CONTRACTS. The amendment to section 1016(a) of the Internal Revenue Code clarifies deductions for taxes, carrying charges, circulation expenditures, and charges under annuity or life insurance contracts. Effective after August 25, 2009. SEC. 3. EXCEPTION TO TRANSFER FOR VALUABLE CONSIDERATION RULES. The amendment to section 101 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 provides an exception to valuable consideration rules for commercial transfers of life insurance contracts, defining a reportable policy sale as the acquisition of an interest in a life insurance contract without a substantial relationship with the insured. The amendment to section 101 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 expands the definition of indirect interest in a life insurance contract to include partnerships, trusts, or other entities. A conforming amendment is made to section 101(a) to include paragraph (3). These amendments apply to transfers after December 31, 2012.
